alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 23 at 9:35AM CDT until April 24 at 1:52PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Quad Cities IA IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Iowa... English River at Kalona affecting Washington and Johnson Counties. .Heavy rain yesterday will push the English river at Kalona just above flood stage. For the English River...including Kalona...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...English River at Kalona. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Agricultural land along the river begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 14.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.1 feet on 07/02/1947. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this evening.
